results.title: Poil de Carotte = Red Head
results.brief_description:
In rural France, ‘Poil de Carotte’, an undernourished and unloved young boy, is badly treated by is ageing mother but his often absent father is unaware of all this. Everything comes to a head when the boy attempts suicide. The film opens a stunning establishing shot, nearly two minutes long and containing eleven distinct movements. ‘Poil de Carotte’ was filmed by Julien Duvivier in 1926 (silent). It was re-made by Paul Mesnier (1952) and Henri Graziani (1973).

Credits: Director, Julien Duvivier ; writers, Julien Duvivier, Jules Renard ; photography, Armand Thirard, Emile Monniot ; music, Alexandre Tansman ; art direction, Lucien Aguettant, Lucien Carre.
Cast: Harry Baur, Robert Lynen, Louis Gauthier, Catherine Fontenay.

results.title: Thomas L'imposteur = Thomas the Imposter
results.brief_description:
Thomas is a 16 year old who poses as the nephew of a general to help a princess get to Paris during World War I. She helps wounded soldiers by taking them back to her castle for medical care.

Credits: Producer, Eugene Lepicier ; director, Georges Franju ; writers, Jean Cocteau, Michel Worms, Georges Franju, Raphael Cluzel ; photography, Marcel Fradetal ; music, Georges Auric.
Cast: Emmanuelle Riva, Fabrice Rouleau, Rosy Varte, Bernard Lavalette, Jean-Roger Caussimon, Michel Vitold, Gabrielle Dorziat, Jean Marais.

results.title: M Comme Mathieu = M as in Mathieu
results.brief_description:
Mathieu is just out of a convalescing home and resumes life at home with wife Jeanne. His mental health is still unstable and he cannot control his obsession for Muriel, an imaginary woman who looks just like Jeanne.

Credits: Producer, Bob Zagury ; director, Jean-Francois Adam ; writer, Jean-Francois Adam ; photography, Pierre Lhomme ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Sami Frey, Brigitte Fossey, Roland Dubillard, Bulle Ogier, Laurent Mirouze.

results.title: En Toute Innocence = No Harm Intended
results.brief_description:
Paul Duchene runs an architecture practice with his son Thomas and Thomas’ wife, Catherine. One day, Paul finds Catherine in the arms of one of his assistants. Seething with rage, he drives off in his car and has an accident that leaves him crippled and mute. Failing a reconciliation, his daughter-in-law plans his murder.

Credits: Producer, Louis Duchesne ; director, Alain Jessua ; writers, Luc Beraud, Alain Jessua, Dominique Roulet ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Michel Portal.
Cast: Michel Serrault, Nathalie Baye, Francois Dunoyer, Suzanne Flon, Philippe Caroit.

results.title: Un Amour a Paris = a Romance in Paris
results.brief_description:
This is an ‘amour fou’ story about two strangers who meet and fall in love in Paris. Marie, is a young Jewish girl from Algeria who comes to Paris with the hope of becoming a model. She is sidetracked when she meets Ali, a French-born Algerian, who has just been released from a 3 year stint in jail. Ali makes plans to meet up with an accomplice to get his share of the money from a robbery in order to travel to Houston,Texas, and become a ‘cosmonaut’. Further reading: ‘Questions of identity in Beur cinema: from ‘Tea in the harem’ to ‘Cheb”. Screen, 34: 4 (Winter 1993): pp 321-342.

Credits: Director, Merzak Allouache ; writer, Merzak Allouache ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu ; music, Jean-Marie Senia.
Cast: Karim Allaoui, Catherine Wilkening, Juliet Berto, Muriel Combeau, Dany Cohn-Bendit.

results.title: Celine et Julie Vont En Bateau = Celine and Julie Go Boating
results.brief_description:
This is an adventure in narrative fiction involving two pairs of heroines and an old dark house in a fairytale that spins around both the protagonists and the audience. One pair (Ogier and Pisier) forms a phantom triangle with a widower in the house of fiction that Berto and Labourier enter. What ensues is a strange, hieratic tragedy borrowed from Henry James. Rivette’s film is in turn magical, joyous and unsettling and, at times, all three at once, a journey through the movie experience itself, an exhilarating display of parodies and genre pastiches forming what amounts to a meditation on the art of illusion. The four female lead actresses collaborated to the writing of the script. Jacques Rivette won the Special Prize of the Jury at the Locarno International Film Festival (1974). Further viewing: ‘Daisies’ (1966) directed by Vera Chytilova [2081701, VHS], from which Rivette took inspiration for ‘Celine and Julie’. Also available on VHS.

Credits: Producer, Barbet Schroeder ; director: Jacques Rivette ; writer, Eduardo de Gregorio ; photography, Jacques Renard ; music, Jean-Marie Senia ; editor, Nicole Lubtchansky.
Cast: Juliet Berto, Dominique Labourier, Bulle Ogier, Marie-France Pisier, Barbet Schroeder.

results.title: Mauvais Sang = Bad Blood
results.creator_credit: Leos Carax, Alain Dahan and Philippe Diaz
results.brief_description:
Alex’s father, an old ganster, has just died. For old time’s sake, Alex asks two former accomplices of his father to organise one last robbery. The target is a new antidote designed to fight a virus called STBO. STBO is spread by having impersonal sex and is killing adolescents by the score. With ‘Mauvais Sang’ (his second film), Leos Carax finds his way into an esthetic movement of French cinema emerging in the 1980’s as ‘neo-baroque’ (aka ‘cinema du look’). Just like Luc Besson and Jean-Jacques Beineix, Carax favours outrageous lighting effects, a very pronounced acting style and a fetishist usage of objects. Awards: Prix Louis Delluc, 1986.

Credits: Producers, Alain Dahan, Philippe Diaz ; director, Leos Carax ; writer, Leos Carax ; photography, Jean-Yves Escoffier ; music, Charlie Chaplin, Sergei Prokofiev, Benjamin Britten.
Cast: Denis Lavant, Juliette Binoche, Michel Piccoli, Hans Meyer, Julie Delpy, Hugo Pratt, Serge Reggiani, Mireille Perrier, Jerome Zucca.

results.title: Jenny
results.brief_description:
Jenny, the manager of a nightclub of dubious reputation, gets involved with Lucien, a member of a gang of criminals. Benoit, the crooked owner of the club, employs a hunchback accomplice to help put an end to their affair. Meanwhile, Jenny’s daughter falls in love with Lucien and becomes her mother’s rival. ‘Jenny’ is Marcel Carne’s first film as director and the first of seven collaborations with screenwriter Jacques Prevert. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Director, Marcel Carne ; writers, Jacques Prevert, Pierre Rocher, Jacques Constant ; photography, Jean Stelli ; music, Joseph Kosma, Lionel Cazaux ; art direction, Jean d’Eaubonne.
Cast: Francoise Rosay, Albert Prejean, Charles Vanel, Lisette Lanvin, Jean-Louis Barrault, Robert Le Vigan, Roland Toutain, Sylvia Bataille, Margo Lion, Rene Genin.

results.title: Rendez-Vous a Bray = Meeting in Bray
results.brief_description:
Of Luxembourg nationality, Julien is not drafted for the First World War, and is therefore able to continue his piano lessons in Paris. His friend Jacques is a pilot doing service at the war front. One day, Julien receives a telegram in which Jacques invites him for a stay at his remote estate in Bray. Julien leaves to meet his friend, but Jacques does not show up. His only company at the lovely estate is a reticent woman whom, he assumes to be the housekeeper. By the time Julien decides to return to Paris, persuaded his friend has died in the war, he reads in the newspaper that the weather may have been the cause of Jacques’absence. Reference: Flanders International Film Festival (Ghent). http://www.surf-inn.be/Archieven/filmfestival/eng/program/filmlist/PBP/rendezvousbray.htm

Credits: Director, writer, Andre Delvaux ; photography, Ghislain Cloquet.
Cast: Bulle Ogier, Roger van Hool, Boby Lapointe, Jean Bouise, Anna Karina, Mathiey Carriere.

results.title: Chouans! (Cinemascope Print)
results.creator_credit: Philippe De Broca and Ariel Zeitoun
results.brief_description:
Aristocrat, philosopher and inventor, Count Savinien de Kerfadec loses his wife as she gives birth to their daughter, Celine. The same night he brings home Aurele, a newborn he found of the doorstep of the church. A few years later, young Tarquin who is on his way to the seminar, runs away and becomes the third addition to the eccentric Kerfadec household. As the children grow up, a love triangle develops, until the day the boys are sent away to make their way in the world. In 1793, Tarquin comes back to Brittany as a representant of the Republic, in charge of repressing the uprising in the Western provinces and possibly woe Celine. But Aurele and Celine, whose love for each other has blossomed, are active among those called ‘Les Chouans’.

Credits: Producer, Ariel Zeitoun ; director, Philippe de Broca ; writers, Daniel Boulanger, Philippe de Brocca, Jerome Tonnerre ; photography, Bernard Zitzermann ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Sopphie Marceau, Lambert Wilson, Philippe Noiret, Stephane Freiss, Jean-Pierre Cassel, Roger Dumas.
